meanings.sent1: I put up new blindings in my room to keep the sunlight out.
meanings.sent2: The blindings in the living room were a lovely shade of blue.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the blindings, thinking they were a fun toy.
meanings.sent4: The blindings cast interesting shadows on the floor in the afternoon light.
meanings.sent5: The blindings fluttered in the breeze, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The act of making someone unable to see
meanings.sent1: The villain used blindings to keep the hero from escaping.
meanings.sent2: Blindings can be a cruel form of punishment if used improperly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved temporary blindings to confuse the audience.
meanings.sent4: The blindings of fear clouded his judgment in the dark alley.
meanings.sent5: The blindings of ignorance prevented him from seeing the truth.

meanings.sent1: The blindings of the sun made it hard to see the road ahead.
meanings.sent2: She shielded her eyes from the blindings of the stage lights.
meanings.sent3: The blindings of the neon sign were almost blinding at night.
meanings.sent4: The blindings of the snow reflected the sunlight, creating a dazzling effect.
meanings.sent5: The blindings of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.
